Empires & Puzzles Rosalind Review: The Cheerful Captain of the Garrison

Rosalind brings a smile and a massive shield to the battlefield. With fast healing, damage reduction stacks, and a Mega Minion that cleanses, she is a defensive powerhouse. But how does she hold up against the latest power creep? Read our detailed analysis to find out if this Cheerful Captain still commands respect.
Rosalind Hero Review: Joyful Healing & Mega Tankiness
Rosalind: The Cheerful Captain Who Jugples Apples and Damage

Rosalind arrived in Empires & Puzzles back in October 2024 as part of the Garrison Guards family, bringing a refreshing mix of positivity and unyielding defense to the Holy element. As a 5-star Legendary Cleric, she quickly established herself as a premier "tanky healer," combining fast mana speed with the formidable Shield Guard Mega Minion mechanic. Unlike the brooding, dark themes often found in high-level heroes, Rosalind is literally juggling apples in the middle of a siege, which is the level of unbothered we all aspire to be.

Rosalind’s artwork is a breath of fresh air. Titled the "Cheerful Captain," she is depicted in mid-juggle, sporting a wide, infectious grin while clad in practical yet polished Garrison armor. The color palette mixes the warm golds of the Holy element with the earthy greens of her uniform, creating a look that is both grounded and radiant. It is a stark contrast to the grimaces of her Goblin enemies. The apple juggling isn't just a quirky detail; it visually represents her ability to handle multiple roles—healing, defending, and cleansing—with effortless grace.

When we look at Rosalind's stats in the context of late 2025, the passage of time is visible. With a base Power of 1110, she sits significantly below the modern benchmark of 1260+ seen in heroes released in December 2025 (like Adelitza or Ulius C1). Her base Attack (1083), Defense (1161), and Health (2012) were elite upon release but are now considered "solid average" or slightly below the top tier. However, stats aren't everything for a support hero. Her ability to survive relies heavily on her Mega Minion, which essentially acts as a second health bar, artificially inflating her effective durability far beyond what the raw numbers suggest.
Special Skill: A Moment of Joy
, is a multi-layered defensive package that justifies her Fast mana speed.
While 30% might seem modest compared to slower healers who top up the whole team, doing this at Fast speed allows her to mitigate damage frequently rather than waiting for a crisis.

This is the sleeper hit of her kit. A -5% reduction to all damage received, stacking up to 10 times (-50%), makes her team progressively harder to kill the longer the fight goes on. Since she is Fast, she can ramp this up surprisingly quickly.

This is the star of the show. Summoning a minion with 65% of her HP is massive. If her max health is around 2500 (with emblems and limit breaks), that minion has over 1600 HP. It essentially doubles her survivability.

The Mega Minion cleanses the latest ailment from all allies every turn. This passive pressure on debuff-heavy teams is invaluable, keeping her team running smoothly without needing to fire a special skill to cleanse.
Let's break down the mechanics to see why she remains effective:
Fast. She requires 8 tiles to charge (7 with adequate mana troops/bonuses). This speed is critical for maintaining her Mega Minion uptime.
30% of max HP. For a teammate with 2500 HP, that is a 750 HP heal. It is bursty and frequent.
With a fully Limit Broken stats (approx. 2481 HP), the Mega Minion has
. This is effectively a meat shield that protects her from almost two average sniper hits from modern heroes before her actual HP is touched.
At max stacks (10), incoming damage is halved. Even just 3 casts (easily achievable in a raid) provide 15% reduction, which is equivalent to a permanent defense buff.
Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities
The Garrison Guard family and her personal kit add layers of utility that keep her relevant despite stat creep.
The Garrison family bonus typically involves boosting stats or protecting against specific mechanics inherent to the Goblin/Garrison storylines.

This is huge in high-level play. Heroes that rely on cutting mana (like Waterpipe or various Goblins) find themselves walled by Rosalind. She will charge when you expect her to, making her reliable on defense.
Removing Wither effects every 4 turns is a direct counter to the soft-timer mechanic of Goblin heroes that wither stats down. It keeps her base stats intact for longer.

(previously Boosted Regen in beta) allows her to punish enemies even when they try to chew through her massive health pool. While not as universally useful as a defensive ailment immunity, it adds a sting to her tankiness.

Upon her release in October 2024, Rosalind was a meta-shaker. She introduced a "Fast Cleric Healer" archetype that was incredibly difficult to take down due to the sheer size of her Mega Minion. She was a staple in top-tier defenses, often flanked by heavy hitters who could hide behind her sustain.
Fast forward to late 2025, and the raw stats of new heroes have eclipsed hers. New attackers hit harder, and new tanks have higher base durability. However, the

of a 65% HP Mega Minion scales well. As you boost her health with troops and aethers, the minion gets stronger. The Damage Reduction stack also scales indefinitely in value—50% less damage is 50% less damage, regardless of how high the attack stat goes (mostly).
Rosalind is no longer the undisputed queen of defense, but she is far from obsolete. She remains a

for offensive raids and wars. On defense, she has fallen off slightly in the top 100 due to the prevalence of "Anti-Minion" and "Anti-Mega Minion" tech (like the Magic Carpet passives), but for the vast majority of players (Diamond arena and below), she is still a formidable obstacle. She is a hero you are happy to have and definitely worth leveling.
Rosalind relies on staying alive to keep her stacks growing and her minions active. Her Mega Minion's HP is derived from her
, making Health the most valuable stat for her.
Maximizes the HP of the Shield Guard Mega Minion. Increases her raw survivability. Makes her heals (percentage-based) slightly more effective on herself.
Her tile damage and Mega Minion attack (which is 180% of her attack) will be lower.
Her Mega Minion hits incredibly hard (180% of caster's attack is no joke). Increases tile damage.
Makes her and her minion significantly squishier, risking her dying before she can stack her damage reduction.
path is recommended. The primary value of Rosalind is sustain. A dead healer heals no one, and a larger Mega Minion protects her for longer.
The 65% HP shield is one of the best survival tools in the game, acting like a pseudo-taunt for the caster.
30% heal at Fast speed is excellent tempo.
The passive cleanse from the minion is annoying for ailment-heavy teams to deal with.
Damage reduction stacks make her stronger the longer the battle lasts.
Innate resistance to mana reduction guarantees she fires.
She is hard countered by heroes who destroy minions/Mega Minions instantly or steal them.
As a healer, she struggles against heal reduction or heal blocking if her minion isn't active to cleanse it first.
Her base defense is starting to look thin against 2025 snipers if her minion isn't up.
Newer hero families (like Magic Carpet) have passives specifically designed to weaken Mega Minions, reducing her effectiveness in specific matchups.
She allows you to play aggressively while keeping a safety net. Her speed lets her recover from bad boards quickly.
Still a solid Tank or Flank option in most alliances.
While she is fast, in Rush she becomes a machine gun of healing and minions.
Her durability and cleanse make her great for surviving long, grueling stages.
Rosalind (Flank) + a heavy Taunt hero (Tank). The Taunt protects the team while Rosalind keeps the tank alive and builds her stacks.

Pair with other Mega Minion or beefy Minion summoners (like Flip or other Goblins). While they compete for space, the sheer wall of HP forces enemies to bring minion removal, limiting their team building.
Pair with fast hitters. Rosalind keeps them topped up while they pick off enemies one by one.
Heroes that specifically target Mega Minions are her nightmare.
Heroes that inflict un-cleansable wither or growth reduction can eventually neutralize her stats.
Those with passives that disable minion effects or punish minion summoners.

If you pulled Rosalind, celebrate! She is a game-changer for early and mid-game progression. Prioritize leveling her immediately. She will carry you through map stages and keep your team alive in raids against much stronger opponents. Do not worry about her stats being "lower" than the newest shiny toy; her mechanics are top-tier.

You likely have her Limit Broken already. If not, consider if you need another Holy healer. If you have newer 2025 healers with higher stats, she might be a secondary war team option. However, for 5-star tournaments (especially Buff Booster or Bloody Battle where her minion acts as health), she remains elite. Be wary of using her on defense in the top 100 where anti-minion passives are common.
The community reaction to Rosalind was overwhelmingly positive, bordering on fear.
"Her and revna are the new gen freaking cleric healers"
— Players immediately recognized her power creep potential upon release.
"She adds 5% DR stack. Way too OP if she healed more"
— Many users realized that her healing percentage was kept in check (30%) solely because her damage reduction stack and Mega Minion were so potent.
"She is attacking and defending both sides every turn"
— A keen observation on the dual nature of her Mega Minion, which hits hard while shielding her.
"She is literally one of the best heroes in the game... I can raid against 7000-8000 power teams... and win"
— This testimony highlights her ability to punch up effectively.
There was a notable debate about her Aether Power changing from Boosted Regen to Counterattack in Beta, which some felt was a nerf, but Counterattack actually synergizes well with her high HP minion.

Rosalind is the definition of a "force multiplier." She doesn't just heal; she mitigates future damage and actively protects herself with a massive meat shield. While the relentless march of stats in Empires & Puzzles has pushed her off the absolute peak of the mountain, she remains high up on the slopes, juggling her apples and keeping her team alive with a smile. She is a reliable, durable, and versatile hero who has aged gracefully into a support role that any roster would be lucky to utilize.
A joyful addition to any roster that stands the test of time.
